Class BasicECA

java.lang.Object
BasicECA
public class BasicECA extends Object
Utility class for elementary cellular automata (ECA), Wolfram codes 0-255

    • ruleExtensions

      public int[][] ruleExtensions
      Wolfram codes of ECA beyond row 1, by size of input neighborhood, includes even numbers as a 2-bit place number. Contains data for the last extended ECA rule in ruleExtension()

  • Method Details

    • ruleExtension

      public int[][] ruleExtension(int n)
      Set of wolfram codes for a given ECA rule beyond row 1, calculated by running the ECA for every possible input neighborhood with length log(wolframLength(rows))
      Parameters:
      n - elementary cellular automata rule
      Returns:
      array of wolfram codes for a given ECA rule beyond row 1

    • lrTableInit

      public void lrTableInit()
      Generates the left-right-black-white rule symmetry groups for the 0-255 elementary cellular automata

      The black white symmetry is generated by reversing the 8 bits of the wolfram code and negating them

      The left right symmetry is generated by reversing the 3 places (1's place, 2's place, 4's place) of each of the 8 bits

      Left-right-black-white symmetry is doing both of the operations

    • display

      public void display()
      Outputs the left-right-black-white rule symmetry groups

    • basicOut

      public int[][] basicOut(int n, int rows, int columns)
      Elementary cellular automata with single-bit initial input
      Parameters:
      n - elementary cellular automata rule, 0-255
      rows - number of rows to calculate
      columns - number of columns to calculate
      Returns:
      2D binary integer array with the results of the ECA's single bit init input;

    • randomOut

      public int[][] randomOut(int n, int rows, int columns, int widthRandom)
      Elementary cellular automata with random initial input
      Parameters:
      n - elementary cellular automata rule, 0-255
      rows - number of rows to calculate
      columns - number of columns to calculate
      widthRandom - desired width of random input
      Returns:
      2d integer array of ECA rule with random initial input

    • ruleClassify

      public int[] ruleClassify()
      Behavior classes of the ECA
      Returns:
      an integer array of every ECA's class
